item.title: Kelly add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled." -- Plutarch

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description:
"It has often been said there’s so much to be read, you never can cram all those words in your head.
So the writer who breeds more words than he needs is making a chore for the reader who reads.
That's why my belief is the briefer the brief is, the greater the sigh of the reader's relief is.
And that's why your books have such power and strength. You publish with shorth! (Shorth is better than length.)" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain
